info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 9:38AM CDT until June 19 at 10:09AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Mulberry Creek Near Salina affecting Saline County.
Smoky Hill River Near Mentor affecting Saline and McPherson Counties.
Smoky Hill River At Lindsborg affecting McPherson County.
Smoky Hill River near New Cambria affecting Saline County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Mulberry Creek near Salina.
* WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected. Depending on if high flows are present on the Saline River this may backup water on Mulberry Creek which would cause the property on the KOA campground to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 3.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 26.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING
